item.title: custom ggplot2 theme
item.description: I spoke about custom ggplot2 themes at the last BURN meetup. My slides are available here but I will give you a somewhat extended summary here. A custom theme could come in handy both in academia and industry to ensure a consistent style. Motivation As easy as it is to generate meaningful and complex charts with ggplot2 it can be tedious to control every detail of your chart to make it publication-ready.

item.title: ggplot2: exploration of the group aesthetics
item.description: I have made several plots with ggplot2 in the past 2 years and occasionally got errors related to the group aesthetics. I solved these issues without once taking the time to fully understand how the group aesthetic works. This blogpost is a result of my experiments to finally explore how it works. My understanding is a combination of my experiments and Hadley Wickhams outstanding book about ggplot2. (https://github.com/hadley/ggplot2-book) Scenario 1: mapping based on one variable Our dummy data will be a unit square.
